text: The men's high jump competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 11 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Tom Woods of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |2.34 |Tbilisi, Soviet Union |June 16, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |2.25 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All heights shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Qualification=== Qualifying perf. 2.00 (Q) or 12 best performers (q) advanced to the Final. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !
